sentences.english: As a teacher, I have a natural job responsibility to critique the work of others.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名老师，我的天职就是批评别人。

sentences.english: The Church says that its duty is to follow the example of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 教会认为效法耶稣是他们的天职。

sentences.english: It is universally acknowledged that it is the doctor’s duty and obligation to heal the wounded and rescue the dying.
sentences.chinese: 全世界都知道救死扶伤是医生的天职。

sentences.english: He put the driver's bounden duty to respectable degree.
sentences.chinese: 他把司机的天职发挥到可敬佩的程度。

sentences.english: Protect the safety of labors is our bounden duty.
sentences.chinese: 保护人类的生命是我们的天职。

sentences.english: I live but to obey, your majesty.
sentences.chinese: 服从乃是小臣的天职，陛下。

sentences.english: This is the job of a spy.
But I still drive to perform the full duty, indomitable.
sentences.chinese: 但我仍然劲头十足地履行天职，不屈不挠。

sentences.english: The nursing of the sick, said Florence Nightingale, is a vocation as well as a profession.
sentences.chinese: 南丁格尔说，看护病者不仅是职业，也是天职。

sentences.english: Rasta's have many simple but fulfilling vocations and talents.
sentences.chinese: 塔法里教徒有许多简单而又能履行天职和才能。

sentences.english: The duty of mankind is to be brave to explore truth.
sentences.chinese: 人的天职在于勇于探索真理。

sentences.english: "To protect the safety of your life and property is our bounden duty ".
sentences.chinese: “保护您的生命财产安全是我们的天职”。

definition: (to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
to help the dying and heal the injured
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
to treat the disease to save the patient/to criticize a person in order to help him
mission/long-term task to which one devotes oneself/a calling
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
